sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. In this figure we have \(EF \parallel DI \), and \(EG \parallel DJ \). Now, prove that \(FG \parallel IJ \).
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
In the triangle HID , we have $EF \parallel DI $. So, we can write that
\[
	\frac{F\input[s1v1]{} }{FI } = \frac{HE }{\input[s1v2]{}D }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now, again in triangle HJD , we have $EG \parallel DJ $. So, we can write
\[
	\frac{HE }{ED } = \frac{H\input[s2v1]{} }{\input[s2v2]{}J }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
From the above two equations, we get
\[
	\frac{\input[s3v1]{}F }{FI } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{}G }{GJ }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Thus, in the triangle HIJ we can write 
\[
	\frac{HF }{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{}} = \frac{HG }{GJ }
\]

"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Which means $FG \parallel IJ $. Hence proved.
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["H", "E"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle HID , we have $EF \parallel DI $, therefore, from the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{HF }{FI } = \frac{HE }{ED }$.}$$"}, {"data": ["G", "G"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle HJD , we have $EG \parallel DJ $, therefore, again using the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{HE }{ED } = \frac{HG }{GJ }$.}$$ "}, {"data": ["H", "H"], "text": "$$\text{Using property, if $a = b$, and $a = c$, then $b = c$, therefore, from the above results we can write $\frac{HF }{FI } = \frac{HG }{GJ }$}$$"}, {"data": ["F", "I"], "text": "$$\text{Using converse of Thale's Theorem we can say that in the triangle $HIJ$, if $\frac{HF }{FI } = \frac{HG }{GJ }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
